quote: I most often use AI to create graphics and Facebook posts. Thanks to that I have very nice content, interesting mainly visually and substantively.

Very often I ask AI about curiosities regarding the world or various topics I don't yet know the answers to. AI explains all topics very well and in detail, and it also talks about various things, so it's a very interesting tool for everyday use, of course with caution.
For example, I asked who would win the presidential election, and AI was very diplomatic, not pointing to any candidate. I really liked that it was so impartial.
I think such a personal AI assistant should know everything related to me, in particular my plan of action and remind me of various things.
I hope it won't go the wrong way, that one day robots will rule us, but for now I believe it's a nice, useful and helpful tool, if you don't use it all the time.

I think it should remind everyone that physical activity is necessary to maintain a balance between work and daily life, because staying cooped up at home can only have a negative impact on a person, on their behavior, habits and discouragement from life.

I think the ideal AI assistant should also offer words of encouragement. Many people are lonely these days, because technology has unfortunately developed so that it's easier for us to write a message than to meet someone face-to-face, in person, for coffee, for a walk, for anything.
Now, these days, you don't see children playing ball in the yard as often as before, jumping rope, just living together as a community, playing together and simply living.

Certainly it would be consistent with work and everyday life, connecting AI with the calendar. Maybe not so much with email, because there is sensitive data there that could later be stored or used by artificial intelligence.
I think it should all be done with an agreement, but only with access at the level that the person agrees to.
I had the impression that AI is more willing to talk, more factual and to the point. I won't even mention the knowledge, the conversation was smooth. As I said, matter-of-fact.
It always had time, which is also significant, so at any moment you can use it and know that you will get an answer.
Yes, people are false. Face-to-face they tell you different things, and behind your back they can stab you in the back. On that matter, unfortunately, people cannot be honest.
They can't say directly what's on their heart. They prefer to gossip rather than just be human.
